node.title: ABBA releases new comeback album Voyage after 40-year hiatus
node.description: Swedish pop sensation ABBA has made a comeback with their new album Voyage, nearly 40 years after they split up, with a digital avatar concert eventually planned in London.

node.title: Tourism operators 'skating on jelly' amid restrictions
node.description: Tourism operators that rely on a summer influx of Aucklanders fear a death knell if travel restrictions are not lifted by Christmas.

node.title: A Nuclear-Powered Shower? Russia Tests a Climate Innovation.
node.description: A remote Siberian town now has its own miniature nuclear plant as a Russian state company tests a new model for residential heating. Some see it as a tool to minimize climate change.

node.title: ‘Love Hard’ Review: Seeking Connection, Not Perfection
node.description: When a perennially single journalist travels across the country to meet her dream guy, she finds she’s been catfished.

node.title: 'Game on': Tourism critical of WA's roadmap while business calls on community to get vaccinated
node.description: There's a mixed reaction to the government's roadmap to opening WA's borders, with tourism operators expressing disappointment and the business lobby urging the community to get vaccinated.

node.title: 'I didn't sleep last night': Residents devastated by compulsory acquisition of homes for North-South Corridor
node.description: The state government has sent letters to residents whose properties will be compulsorily acquired as part of the last installment of the North-South Corridor.

node.title: Lost moose leaps through classroom window in Canada
node.description: Students in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan got an up-close lesson on the animal kingdom yesterday, when a moose crashed through the window of their school.

node.title: Covid-19: Two separate attempts to flee MIQ in Hamilton and Auckland
node.description: A Covid-19 case fled a Hamilton MIQ facility this morning by removing a section of fencing and jumping into a waiting car, but were stopped by police a few minutes later, in the second fleeing…

node.title: COP26: Indonesia criticises 'unfair' deal to end deforestation
node.description: Indonesia has criticised the terms of a global deal to end deforestation by 2030, signalling that the country may not abide by it.

node.title: Western Australian man charged with abducting Cleo Smith
node.description: A 36-year-old man faces court after being charged over the abduction of four-year-old Cleo Smith during a family camping trip.

node.title: South Dunedin double murderer sentenced to life
node.description: A Dunedin man who murdered a couple and then set their house alight has been sentenced to life imprisonment.

node.title: Sugar recall leaves cookie business in crumbs
node.description: A major sugar recall is hitting businesses big time - with those who ply their trade with sugar having to dump it in huge quantities.

node.title: Scott Morrison COP26 gaffe goes viral on Chinese social media
node.description: Scott Morrison's cops a backlash on Chinese social media after referring to "global momentum to tackle China" instead of "climate change" during a COP26 speech.

node.title: Reserve Bank sees wage growth hitting fastest pace in years — by 2023
node.description: The RBA says Australia's economy is recovering strongly from recent lockdowns, which bodes well for employment and wages growth.

node.title: Jimmy Kimmel: ‘Aaron Is a Karen’
node.description: As Covid sidelined the Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers, Kimmel and other hosts scorned him for implying that he’d been vaccinated.

node.title: Gold Coast must lift jab 'game', Palaszczuk says, as schoolies vax hubs considered
node.description: The Premier has taken aim at flagging rates on the border as the government prepares a social media campaign to target young people who haven't been immunised.

node.title: Father-of-three handed five-year jail term over $500k tax fraud
node.description: An Adelaide man who made up employers and income to defraud the Australian Tax Office out of half a million dollars has been jailed for five years.

node.title: Sydney's inner west light rail shut down for up to 18 months because of cracks
node.description: NSW Transport Minister Rob Stokes announces all 12 light rail vehicles that make up the inner west service will be out of action after cracks were found last month.

node.title: Laughs No More? Australians Are Reassessing a Beloved Cartoonist.
node.description: I used to think Michael Leunig’s drawings embodied the soul of our nation. Now, I’m not so sure.

node.title: Tairāwhiti state of emergency lifted after flooding
node.description: The state of emergency in Tairāwhiti has this afternoon been lifted after three days of torrential rain.

node.title: Fire in historic Christchurch building leads to evacuations
node.description: A derelict building in Christchurch caught fire for the second time in three years this morning - forcing some to evacuate their homes.

node.title: DOC investigating death of 11 fur seals in Kaikōura
node.description: The deaths of eleven fur seals in Kaikōura are being treated as suspicious.

node.title: Israel Moves to Silence the Stalwarts of Palestinian Civil Society
node.description: These human rights activists are not terrorists.

node.title: A US nuclear-powered attack submarine hit something underwater – now its two senior officers have been fired
node.description: The USS Connecticut, a nuclear-powered fast-attack submarine, was reported to have struck an "object" underwater in early October under the busy shipping lanes of the South China Sea.

node.title: NT government pulls vaccination stats from website, admits remote region data was inflated
node.description: The Northern Territory government removes regional vaccine data from its website after being asked why there was a discrepancy of more than 50 per cent compared to the federal government's figures.
